Summary: bright red orb observed during fireworks
divs: sighting detailsunknown objects are frequenting our skies. my family and i observed white orbs approx. 30 days ago and have since been watching the sky nightly. on most clear nights between the hours of 9:30 p.m. and 11:30 p.m. (seems to be peak viewing hours) we see 5 to 10 orbs of different colors and varying degrees of brightness. last during during the monroeville fireworks we watched one bright red orb approach at a fairly low altitude from the west heading east. it made no sound. we thought at first that it might have been a news helicopter but with the lack of sound, no other lighting, and it's sudden disappearance it couldn't have been that. perhaps it was a roman candle? we don't know. the second bright red orb appeared 30 minutes later and also vanished before it reached us. is anyone else in our parts watching the sky and seeing these objects? especially the glowing\brightening\dimming white orbs that we are seeing every time the sky is clear enough for viewing. they usually travel from the north or northwest\ or south or southeast heading toward the opposite direction. sometimes they change direction slightly and\or appear to wobble. occasionally they seem to almost come to a complete stop and shine brilliantly...much bigger and brighter than any other star\planet in the sky and then shoot away quickly after dimming considerably. our feelings are of curiosity, intrigue, anxiety and amazement. we really don't know what to think about the things we are seeing. i need to get a binocular video camera to try to capture some of film.
